meanings.definition: A group of people who are considered to be the original or traditional ruling class in a society.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, the patriciates held significant power and influence.
meanings.sent2: The patriciates in the medieval kingdom were known for their wealth and privilege.
meanings.sent3: The patriciates decided to have a fancy dress party to celebrate their status.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a member of the patriciates when she won the prestigious award.
meanings.sent5: The patriciates were like the royal family of the town, respected by all.

meanings.definition: The status or position of being a member of a patriciate.
meanings.sent1: Achieving patriciates was a dream come true for him.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to reach the patriciates and be recognized for her contributions.
meanings.sent3: He joked that reaching the patriciates meant he could wear a crown every day.
meanings.sent4: The patriciates brought with them a sense of responsibility and honor.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the patriciates meant being at the top of the social ladder.
